flawed_nl_solution:
The 3-year-old dog ages 7 years to one human year so he will technically be 3*7 = <<3*7=12>>12 years old in dog years
Max's dog will be 12 when Max turns 3 so the age difference is 12-3 = <<12-3=9>>9

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 21, not 12. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
